result.execSummary:
The defendant Maxwell Steven Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Intimidate Witness, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.42.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs on Count 4. Pay costs only on Counts 1, 2. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
No contact direct or indirect with victims without their consent and consent of Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Write minimun 250 word apology to victims. Submit DNA sample.
Restitution has been paid in full.

timeConds.notes: 30 days of sentence are stayed to be used at discretion of Court through Petition by Dept. of Corrections. Huber privileges granted. 60 days to report.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maxwell Steven Anderson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Maxwell Steven Anderson
Current: N60W34970 Lake Dr, Oconomowoc, WI 53066   (Effective: 10-08-2015)
Prior: N60w34970 Lake Dr, Oconomowoc, WI 53066
for DNA Sample

Defendant Maxwell Steven Anderson in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defendant on status. Defendant wants to take offer, requests that jail time be dropped or sentencing postponed. State rejects counteroffer, advises of plea agreement. State moves to amend Count 4 to misdemeanor. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty pleas to Counts 1, 2, 4. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2, 4. Count 3 is dismissed but read in for sentencing.  State makes sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Maxwell Steven Anderson in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of meeting with Defendant, thought Defendant would be requesting an adjournment, has no objection to request for adjournment for Defendant work on some issues. Court questions State, who has made offer. Court questions Defendant, who is considering taking offer. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Maxwell Steven Anderson
Current: 10647 Highway 42, Sister Bay, WI 54234 United States  (Effective: 08-31-2015)
Prior: N60w34970 Lake Dr, Oconomowoc, WI 53066

Defendant Maxwell Steven Anderson in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, withdrawal of Atty Schaefer. Court questions Defendant on what he's going to do about an attorney. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Defendant advises of move to Sister Bay, doesn't know exact address, will provide information to Clerk of Court's office.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Consent and Order for Withdrawal and Discharge of Attorney
Court changes no contact with DT or BT to no VIOLENT contact.

Defendant Maxwell Steven Anderson in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of offer, advises that Defendant is unsure how he wants to proceed, requests status conference. Court reviews time limit waiver. Court reviews bond modification request. State requests no violent contact. Court orders no violent contact.  Status conference scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
No Contact Modification Request
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand
by Defendant

Defendant Maxwell Steven Anderson in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advises Defense of prelim scheduling. State questions whether status should be scheduled instead of prelim. Defense requests status, advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Linda Jean Schaefer in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that there are no times available within time limits, needs to put formal waiver on record, Defendant has left, but during conversations with Defendant, he was willing to waive time limits. Court needs Defendant to at least call in.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant Maxwell Steven Anderson in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Set prelim.
Adjourned initial appearance at 07-20-2015 10:00 am
No contact direct or indirect with DT or BT and their residence.

Defendant Maxwell Steven Anderson in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Atty Gerbers advises that other counsel will be appointed, requests AIA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 6/3/15.
